html:
Igor Sirotov Architects creates a concrete haven in bali

The MB3H residence by Igor Sirotov Architects reimagines industrial concrete as a canvas for modern elegance. Located in Bali, Indonesia, the space is defined by its exposed concrete surfaces that set the tone for a monumental ambiance, with extensive integration of natural light and minimalist furnishings that soften the boldness of the materiality and provide comfort for residents.

The open-plan layout encourages a seamless fluidity between spaces, with touches of indoor greenery providing a vibrant counterpoint to the stark materials, enlivening them with organic vitality. Deep blue accents also punctuate the design, offering moments of richness amidst the minimalist palette.


all images courtesy of Igor Sirotov Architects

touches of greenery invite organic vitality at the MB3H house

Igor Sirotov Architects, a practice based in Kiev, juxtaposes raw, textural elements with clean lines and carefully curated furnishings that create an artful balance between strength and comfort. Natural light also plays a pivotal role at MB3H, streaming through large windows that enhance the open layout and connect the interior to the surrounding environment.

This interplay between light and material emphasizes the precision of the design, while subtle lighting elements introduce an intimate warmth to the space. ‘Every detail, from the sculptural bath to the functional yet stylish furniture, is crafted to offer both beauty and practicality, making this home a true sanctuary,’ notes architect Igor Yuryevich Sirotov.
